content:
Are we intending for stream descriptions to be a sentence, or a paragraph?
I'll adjust my sample descriptions (in the default streams) depending on what we're guiding admins towards.

My inclination is they should be short, and almost every stream description on chat.zulip.org is < 15 words. But this isn't consistent with the fact that we support markdown in the stream descriptions.

Semi-relatedly, markdown in streams is currently fairly broken:
pasted image
pasted image
I think descriptions should be fairly short.
@Rishi Gupta the markdown is more for being able to include emoji, bold, links, etc, than bulleted lists.

ahh, that makes more sense :). Though I'm not even sure I'm in favor of that, given the variety of places the stream description shows up (left side of stream settings, compose box typeahead, maybe title text or in popovers, etc), and the fact that we haven't felt a need to use that feature on chat.zulip.org.
We actually do use a few links in chat.zulip.org descriptions, and probably should use more.
These are all things it'd be fine to have be rendered as the text versions if need be

Long stream descriptions are a bit awkward. It seems the only way to see them complete is viewing the full settings for the stream.
The navbar shows a truncated description, and clicking on it (in the hope that it would be shown in full) just turns the bar into a search box.
The list of streams (in settings) shows also a truncated description in each stream widget, and clicking on it brings the full settings on the right panel, where the full description is available, but it's quite unconspicuous...

I'd suggest the full description could be shown as a "tooltip" on the navbar and on the left sidebar, and as multiline in the stream settings widgets.

I agree with that. Also, it would be nice if there was an easier way to see basic stream information from the stream list on the left sidebar without having to open the stream settings or the stream itself because sometimes you are just searching the correct stream to post something.
Yeah, in theory this is on @Yash âœ¨'s TODO list.
We should probably aim to make that happen relatively early in this release cycle as it may take some iteration.
